page.title: 10Village life in General.
page.content: Except for the new development of a few bungalows, built by Cheadle Council and some private home in School Close, the village of Dilhorne has changed little over the years. Victorian cottages sit next to farm steads and homes built for farm labourers and miners of previous generations. A picture of housing built sparingly into those 'infil' patches of a village lying in green belt.These depict not only the rise and fall of minning but also the changes in agriculture-a social patchwork of English Life. The houses span the years with small cottages that once belonged to the estate;larger homes for those who may have had servants, reflecting a more properous Victorian era. Post war counci development and modern farm & commuter homes.
